hackathon-description-text: Welcome to UofTHacks V, a 36-hour nonstop celebration of technology.  Whether you’re a beginner hacker or veteran, there is something for you here.  We’ll have workshops and mentors to help you learn and grow, recruiters to help your professional development, and great prizes for the most impressive and creative hacks.  We’d love it if you #celebratewithus!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Manager, Product Platforms with Interac Association and Acxsys Corporation

hackathon-eligibility: We welcome hackers of all experience levels.  Our maximum team size is 4.
hackathon-rules:
We follow MLH's Code of Conduct.  This can be found 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The best hack or app built using the Interac E-Transfer Public API will win a cash prize of $1000!
The team with the best use of StdLib will win 4 Nintendo Switch Consoles!

Turn your idea into Action and you could win your team the Google Home Mini, a Pixel 2 (up to 4 devices), and the chance to work alongside Google Actions Engineers to bring your Action to life for over 400M users! (2 x 1 hour remote working sessions).
For the best team that uses any of the following Microsoft APIs or Devices:
The best game created by hackers will receive 4 Ubisoft Prize Packs!
LiteHawk BURST Quadcopter Drone with Camera
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of IBM Watson Visual Recognition API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team whose application best provides a REST API with the right mix of useful capabilities and technical excellence will receive $25 Amazon Gift Cards (one per team member) and interviews with RBC!
For the team with the best hack that helps everyday folk do everyday tasks, Krate will award $200 of BCH + 3 months free delivery across Krate operated services.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: For the best health hack, we will be awarding a Bitalino Kit!
The UTSU's challenge is to design a user-friendly campus map that would allow clubs and groups to advertise their events based on location. The ideal submission would:
The best project that utilizes the Ethereum blockchain for any part of their project will be awarded 1 Eth by ChainSafe Systems and MLG Blockchain Consulting.
The overall winners of the hackathon will receive 1 year of free personal subscription for any single JetBrains tool/IDE.

We'll be judging using Gavel.

hackathon-description-header: Join 500 brilliant developers, inspiring designers, and innovative creators for 36 hours of hacking at UofT's annual hackathon!
hackathon-location-description: University of Toronto - Bahen Centre for Information Technology
